content:
If this is a POP account, they will remain--BUT, in closing the account be sure to NOT allow the messages to be deleted. My suggestion would be to first copy all folders in the account to new Local Folders folders.

If this is an IMAP account, you need to do this: - click File>offline>Download and select the desired folders - once downloaded, copy the folders to a new folder in Local Folders area. These steps ensure that the messages are now separate from the IMAP account and will remain after closing the account. You can then remove the account. Also, since these are import for you, be sure to do a profile backup afterward as these are now the only copy.
creator: davidsk

content: My guess is that you had Thunderbird running on the source computer when you did the copy. I suggest repeating the process but have Thunderbird closed. You're copying the entire profile so all entries would be copied as one.
creator: davidsk

Google pays Mozilla, for it's placement in the Firefox product.

Thunderbird is in a separate company from Firefox, has no such arrangement.

content:
Thanks.

In current versions, the normal default location for profile will have "default-release" in the name. Do you see such a directory in file explorer? And is there data there?
creator: wsmwk

content: Hi - there is no directory by that name "default-release" - the only one that is close is the 4ddni481.default folder, which sits under Appdata/roaming/Thunderbird/Profiles - 4ddni481.default houses many folders - blocklists, browser-extension-data, mail, ImapMail, settings folder etc and 145 files many of which are xxx.v2.sqlite, and xxx.v3.sqlite.
